sen.j: 愛宕郡（おたぎのこおり・おたぎぐん）は山城国・京都府にかつて存在した郡である。
sen.e: Otagi District was the district that existed in Yamashiro Province, Kyoto Prefecture.
Otagi District was a district that existed in Yamashiro Province, Kyoto Prefecture.
Otagi no Kori (Otagi-gun) was a district that existed in Yamashiro Province, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 古代に隣接する葛野郡とともに郡域の一部が平安京となり、現在では京都市北区 (京都市)・左京区の大半に相当する。
sen.e: The part of its district became Heiankyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) along with Kado District, which was its neighbor from ancient times, and is currently a main part of Kita Ward (Kyoto City), Kyoto City and Sakyo Ward.

Part of its district became Heiankyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) along with Kado District, which was its neighbor from ancient times, and is currently a main part of Kita Ward (Kyoto City), Kyoto City and Sakyo Ward.

Part of its district became Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) along with Kado District, which was its neighbor from ancient times, and is currently a main part of Kita Ward (Kyoto City) and Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 1645年（正保2年）丹波国桑田郡から、大布施村・八桝村・別所村の3村（後の花背村の一部、現 京都市左京区花背地区）を編入。
sen.e: Three villages (a part of later Hanase Village and current Hanase area, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) of Oofuse, Yamasu, Bessho Villages from Kuwata District, Tanba Province became a part of it in 1645.

Three villages (a part of later Hanase Village and current Hanase area, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) of Oofuse, Yamasu, Bessho Villages from Kuwata District, Tanba Province became a part of the area in 1645.

Three villages (a part of later Hanase Village and current Hanase area, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) of Ofuse, Yamasu, Bessho Villages from Kuwata District, Tanba Province became a part of the area in 1645.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）4月10日 - 郡区町村編制法に基づき下鴨村に愛宕郡役所を設置。
sen.e: April 10, 1879: Following the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), Otagi District Public Hall was established.
April 10, 1879: Following the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), Otagi District Public Hall was established.
April 10, 1879: Following the Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), Otagi District Public Hall was established.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 - 町村制施行に伴い、愛宕郡に17の村が成立する。
sen.e: April 1, 1889: Following the Town and Village Act, seventeen villages were formed within Otagi District
April 1, 1889: Following the Town and Village Act, seventeen villages were formed within Otagi District
April 1, 1889: Following the Town and Village Act, seventeen villages were formed within Otagi District

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年）1月29日 - 鷹峯村から野口村が分立。
sen.e: January 29, 1891: Noda Village became separated from Takagamine Village
January 29, 1891: Noda Village became separated from Takagamine Village
January 29, 1891: Noguchi Village became separated from Takagamine Village

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）4月1日 - 白川村・田中村・下鴨村・鞍馬口村・野口村、上賀茂村・大宮村の一部が京都市上京区に編入。
sen.e: April 1, 1918: A part of Shirakawa, Tanaka, Shimogamo, Kuramaguchi, Noguchi, Kamowakeikazuchi, and Oomiya Villages were incorporated into Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City
April 1, 1918: A part of Shirakawa, Tanaka, Shimogamo, Kuramaguchi, Noguchi, Kamowakeikazuchi, and Oomiya Villages were incorporated into Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City
April 1, 1918: A part of Shirakawa, Tanaka, Shimogamo, Kuramaguchi, Noguchi, Kamigamo and Omiya Villages were incorporated into Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 上賀茂村・大宮村・鷹峯村が京都市上京区に編入。
sen.e: Kamowakeikazuchi, Oomiyam and Takagamine Villages were incorporated into Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kamowakeikazuchi, Oomiyam and Takagamine Villages were incorporated into Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kamigamo, Omiya and Takagamine Villages were incorporated into Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 修学院村・松ヶ崎村が京都市左京区に編入。
sen.e: Shugakuin ad Matsukezaki Villages were incorporated into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shugakuin ad Matsukezaki Villages were incorporated into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shugakuin ad Matsugasaki Villages were incorporated into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）7月1日 - 京都市に愛宕郡・葛野郡・乙訓郡を管轄する北山城地方事務所を設置。
sen.e: July 1, 1942: Kitayama Castle District Office was established to give the jurisdiction over Otagi, Kado, and Otokuni Districts.
July 1, 1942: Kitayama Castle District Office was established to give the jurisdiction over Otagi, Kado, and Otokuni Districts.
July 1, 1942: Northern Yamashiro District Office was established to give the jurisdiction over Otagi, Kadono, and Otokuni Districts.
sen.cmt: 北山城→northern Yamashiroとしました。

sen.j: 雲ヶ畑村が京都市上京区に編入。
sen.e: Kumogahata Village became a part of Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kumogahata Village became a part of Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kumogahata Village became a part of Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 岩倉村・八瀬村・大原村・静市野村・鞍馬村・花脊村・久多村が京都市左京区に編入。
sen.e: Iwakura, Yase, Ohara, No Village of Shizuoka City, Kurama, Hanase, and Kuta Villages were incorporated into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Iwakura, Yase, Ohara, No Village of Shizuoka City, Kurama, Hanase, and Kuta Villages were incorporated into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Iwakura, Yase, Ohara, Shizuichino, Kurama, Hanase, and Kuta Villages were incorporated into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Otagi District was abolished on the same day.
Otagi District was abolished on the same day.
Otagi District was abolished on the same day.

sen.j: 和名抄に見える郡内の郷
sen.e: Go (home village) within the district seen in Wamyo-sho (a dictionary compiled in the Heian period).
Go (home village) within the district seen in Wamyo-sho (a dictionary compiled in the Heian period).

Those within the parenthesis is pronounced in the way of Kun (the Japanese pronunciation of Chinese character).
